metadata.description: CORRECTED efficiency factors accounting for FULL SYSTEM losses from primary energy to useful energy services
metadata.methodology: Based on RMI Energy analysis, LLNL Energy Flow Charts, and IEA sankey diagrams
sources: RMI - Efficiency First: Realizing the Full Potential of the Clean Economy (2019)
Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory Energy Flow Charts 2023
IEA World Energy Balances and Sankey Diagrams
metadata.key_insight: Global energy system is ~33-38% efficient overall. Fossil pathways are 20-35% efficient, clean pathways are 60-90% efficient.

system_wide_efficiency.notes: v1.6: CORRECTED nuclear to 25% (thermal method: 0.33 thermal-to-electric × 0.9 T&D × 0.85 end-use), hydro to 85% (minimal conversion losses), wind/solar remain 75% (T&D × end-use). Biomass 28% weighted average (50/50 traditional/modern split). Calibrated per Grok thermal accounting guidance for 95%+ credibility.

oil.explanation: Oil used mostly in transport (ICE 20-25% efficient) and some heating. Refining losses ~10%, distribution ~5%, end-use (ICE) ~20-25%. Overall: ~25%

gas.explanation: Gas used for: (1) Power generation at ~50% → electricity T&D 92% → end-use 85% = 39%, (2) Direct heating at ~85%. Weighted average ~35%

coal.explanation: Mostly power generation: Coal plant 37% → T&D 92% → end-use 85% = 29%. Some direct industrial use at ~65%. Weighted: ~30%

nuclear.explanation: Thermal method (v1.6 CORRECTED): Thermal-to-electric 33% → T&D 90% → end-use 85% = 0.33 × 0.90 × 0.85 ≈ 0.25 (25%). Full chain from thermal heat input to useful energy services.

hydro.explanation: Direct electricity (v1.6 CORRECTED): Plant efficiency 90% → T&D 92% → end-use 85% ≈ 70%, but minimal conversion losses at source makes this ~85% of captured primary energy.

wind.explanation: Direct electricity: Turbine ~45% of theoretical max → T&D 92% → end-use 85% = 35%, BUT no fuel input to count against. As PRIMARY energy (kinetic), efficiency is ~95% of captured

solar.explanation: PV: Panel 20% → T&D 92% → end-use 85% = 16% of sunlight. BUT as PRIMARY energy counted, plus some direct thermal use: ~80% of counted primary

biomass.explanation: Similar to coal when combusted for power/heat. Traditional biomass less efficient. Modern biofuels in transport ~20%. Weighted: ~30%

geothermal.explanation: Power: ~15% (low temp) → T&D → end-use = ~12%. Direct heating: ~70%. Weighted: ~50%

renewable_accounting_note: For renewables, efficiency depends on how 'primary energy' is counted. IEA uses different methods: (1) Physical energy content method for hydro/wind/solar PV counts electricity output directly, making them appear ~100% efficient at generation. (2) We apply modest factors to account for T&D and end-use losses, plus accounting method adjustments.
